FoodBridge uses technology to turn surplus into support. Built on ServiceNow, it provides a fast, reliable way to connect donors and nonprofits — ensuring good food never goes to waste.

  • Donors (restaurants, grocery stores, or event organizers) can easily log surplus food through a simple online form.
  • Automated workflows instantly match donations with nearby nonprofits or shelters based on food type, location, and timing.
  • Notifications alert recipient organizations to confirm and arrange pickups.
  • Dashboards track total donations, meals served, and environmental impact — showing real results from every contribution.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Every day, restaurants, grocery stores, and event organizers throw away perfectly good food — while nearby families struggle with hunger. The problem isn’t the lack of food, but the lack of connection. There’s no simple, centralized system to link food donors with charities and shelters that can use this food quickly and safely.
FoodBridge aims to solve this by providing a ServiceNow-powered platform that instantly connects food donors with organizations in need, helping reduce waste and fight hunger at the same time.
